titleStmt.title: Sanskrit Manuscripts in the Bodleian Libraries

msContents.summary: A 17th-century paper manuscript of the Antarakathāsaṃgraha, a collection of moral tales by Rājaśekhara of Maladhāra Gaccha [to check the guru of Rājaśekhara as inJRK it's a pupil of Srītilaka of Harṣapūrīya Gaccha]. This work is a collection of moral stories in prose. It is also called as Vinodakathā saṃgraha. 1st Vimala kathā ends on fol.2B; 2nd Badhira kuṭuṃba kathā ends on fol.3A; 3rd Vyāsa kathā ends on fol.3B; 4th Nindaka vṛddhā kathā edns onf ol.3B; 5th Budhyaṃ dhatva kathā edns on fol. 4A; 6th buddhi-prāgallpe Roha kathā ends onfol.6A; 7th Kṣullaka kathā ends on fol.6B;8th Gajatolana kathā end on fol.6B; 9th sapatnī-putra kathā ends on fol.7A; 10th Nidhipati kathā ends on fol. 7B; 11th bhikṣukāraka ends on fol.7B;12th parivrājaka kathā ends on fol.7B; 13th Naimetika kathā ends on fol.8A; on fol.8B - etāś ca buddhyadhikāra .....sva gadyaiḥ. ;14th para-samaya kathā ends on fol.9A; 16th Śrṣṭiputra buddhi-sauṭave kathā ends on fol.9B; 17th Svaśru-vadhū kathā edns on fol.10A; 18th - Jaṭādhara kathā edns on fol.10A; 19th - Strīmāyā kathā ends on f ol.11B; 20th Paṇḍita kathā ends on fol.11B; 21st-Brāhmaṇapātro-jjīvana-draviṇaṃ ends on fol.12A; 22nd-Gṛbhajaka kathā ends on fol.12A ; 23rd-lobha-mūḍha Kṛpaṇikā kathā ends on fol.12B; 24th-Mūrkha kathā ends on fol.13B; 25th-Vañcaka śreṣṭi kathā ends onf ol.13B;26th-Mūrkha-śiṣya kathā ends on fol.14A ; 27th-Vyavahārājña-bodha kathā ends on fol.14A; 28th-Anarthamūla kathā ends on fol. 14B; 29th-Jaḍa-jaṭi kathā ends on f ol.14B; 30th-Avyavahāra Jñavidda kathā edns on fol. 15B; 31st-Avicāra-rāja kathā ends on fol.16A; 32nd-Puṇyādhīna-hita-prāpti kathā ends on fol.16A; 33rd-uppāyajña-vaṇik-kārya-sukha-sādhyatā kathā buddhor vāṇika ends on fol.16B; 34th-Baṭuka kathā ends on fol.16B; 35th-Jaṭila kathā ends onfol.17A; 36th-Saśanka-niḥśanka kathā ends on fol. 17A; 37th-Dhrūtakṛt kathā ends on fol.17B; 38th-Vaṇika kathā ends on fol.17B; 39th-Dhūrtteśvara kathā ends on fol.17B; 40th-Śreṣṭiputra kathā ends on fol.18A; 41st-Mūḍha-vipra kathā ends on fol.18B; 42nd-Strī-mukha-kuvindaka kathā ends on fol.18B; 43rd-Kārya-tattvajña śreṣṭi kathā ends on fol.19A; 44th-Sevaka-śatru svāmi kathā ends on fol.19B; 45th-Jīvitialasa kathā ends on fol.19B; 46th-Sūrim(s)ainika kathā ends on fol.20A; 47th-Kuṃbhakāra mithyā-duḥkṛta kathā ends on fol.20A; 48th-Vaṇik-bhikṣāka kathā ends on fol.20B; 49th-Kṛpaṇa kathā ends on fol.21A; 50th-lubdha-śaṭha kathā ends on fol.21B; 51st-Saṅkala kathā ends on fol.21B; 52nd-Jinadatta kathā ends on f ol.22A; 53rd-Guru-damana yajamāna kathā ends on fol.22B; 54th-Vṛddhamanārhatā kathā ends on fol.23A; 55th-Nirmmayārda-nārī kathā ends on fol.23B; 56th-Niśraddhā-dāna kathā ends on fol.23B; 57th-Cāṭukāra kathā ends on fol.24B; 58th-Śukarja kathā ends on fol.25A; 59thKūṭa-sākṣyika kathā ends on fol.26B; 60th- Karma prābalye vipra kathā ends on fol.27A; 61st-bhakty-ekāgrya Jaṭādhara kathā ends on fol.27A; 62nd-Atṛpyati kathā ends on fol.27A; 63rd-śāḍhya-ddhārmmika kathā ends on fol.27B; 64th-aparāmṛśyakārika kathā ends on fol.27B; 65th-tiloka-prādhānye Śreṣṭi kathā ends on fol.28A; 66th-para-vāk pratyaye Cora kathā ends on fol.28A; 67th-prathamaḍaṃbara katahā ends on fol.29a; 68th-cirakāristuṣā kathā ends on f ol.29A; 69th-lobhe Vipra kathā ends on fol.29B; 70th-mṛṣāvādi Dhūrtta kathā ends on fol.30B; 71st-Asāra-puruṣa kathā ends on fol.30B; 72nd-yattakāri bhikṣu kathā ends on fol.31A; 73rd-Dhūrtta vicitrīkathā ends on fol.31A; 74th-puṇya prabhāva kathā ends on fol.31B; 75th-kurvat-kuhāsyatve kathā ends on fol.32A; 76th-rahasya-prakāśane daṃpati-sneha kathā ends on fol.33A; 77th-Kapāladvaya kathā ends on fol.33B; 78th-Vidyunamālā-śālī-jaladoyamityekā kathā ends on fol.34A; 79th- apaṇḍitena kathā ends on fol.34A; 80th-jaḍa-kārye kathā ends on fol.34B; 81st-viṣama kārye--Khandhaṇi kathā ends on fol.34B; 82nd-vibhūti mattaḥ ends on fol.34B; 83rd-ttathaivaravayāṃvakārṣi ends on fol.34B; 84th-jihvā saṃvarā-bhāve-doṣe mlacchadāsa kathā ends on fol.36A; 84(5)th-guṇagauṇatve prāk puṇya-proḍhau ca pathyā vaidya(ka) kathā ends on fol.36B; [no.84 is twice] so actual kathās are 85 altogether.

msItem.title: Antarakathāsaṃgraha
msItem.incipit: [1r1] yan naikām api kāminīṃ pariṇayasy abhyarthamāno'py alaṃ tan nūnaṃ gṛha-bhāra kātara-tayā mukto-dhyamo-devara mā tsakasva haris trikhaṇḍa vijayī bhrātā sti te sarvado bhāmādyābhir iti ritaḥ smita-mukho Nemir vaśī pātu vaḥ || 1 || jayanti guravo-smākaṃ vadyā-valli-mahīruhāṃ Maladhāri-Gaṇādhīśā śrīTilakasūrayaḥ || 2 || mano-vinoda-hetūnāṃ sabhārhāṇāṃ yathā -śrutaṃ mayā kathānāṃ hṛsvānāṃ kriyate saṅgraho budhāḥ || 3 || tan nāsti kiñcij jagati yad vācyaṃ na yathāsabhaṃ ato Vinoda-kathikā saṅgraho'yaṃ na niṣphalaḥ || 4 || ..|| 5 || sat-kāvya-nāda pakṣyābhyāṃ su-vana-traya dhāriṇī devī Sarasvatī -haṃsī ramatāṃ mama mānase || 6 || yojana --(illegible)ṣaḍ-darśana samākule āsthāne na virodho su kathanīyā kathānikā || 7 || asti śrībhārabhāsuraṃ Śrīpuraṃ nāma nagaraṃ, tatra dvādaśa vrata-dharo ......etc [On Fol.8B]etāś ca buddhyadhikāra pratibaddhā Rohakādi kathā śrīMalayagiri kṛtanaṃ gadhya-bandhy-adhyayana-ṭīkā tastad vacana-bahumānāttaireva gadhyairudhṛtā śeṣaṃ tu śāstraṃ gadhyaiḥ || cha ||
msItem.explicit: [36r?] || cha || kriyāḥ sarvāḥ kāmadudhāḥ prāk-puṇyaṃ balavadhyadi tathāhi ....(on fol.36B-11th line) hemāsanam upaveśyakanaka puṣpaiḥ pūjayitvaṃ -tvā kṛtāñjalir-jāgotva datteyaṃ lakṣmīstāvetaāvayaṃ viṣam apy amṛtaṃ bhavadi ---yā bhavatyevetyabhidhāya mahatī vibhūti madān tato harīta kī vaidyo jātolīlā vilāsā tyāga karṇṇo bhoga purandaraḥ || iti guṇa-gauṇatve prāk-puṇya prauḍhau ca pathyā vaidya(ka) kathā || 84 || pariṣadi rasa śriyāyāṃ rasāvatāraurthamantara kathodhyaṃ Mali(a)dhāra gacchanāthaḥ sūriḥ śrīRājaśekharaḥ kṛtavān || 1 || dvipūrvārdha gītiḥ ṣaṣṭir mātrā vyākhyā su munīndrāṇāṃ cātur vidyā'vatā-rasa'rāsu pūjā suvrṇṇa puṣpa-straja iva phalinī bhavaṃ tvetāḥ || 2 || sumaṅgalaṃ na varaṃ kevalaṃ etā iti Antarakathā prakramāyā tta--svān
msItem.finalRubric: [36v?] Antarakathā-saṅgraho'ayaṃ nāma granthaḥ || cha || śubhaṃ bhūyāt || cha ||

supportDesc.condition: Folio 36 is torn by edges but text is not damaged. From folio 20 - 31 at right part of folio is eaten by the warms and slightly torn but text is not damaged.

layout.p: 15 lines per page, approximately 60-65 akṣaras per line.
Double marginal frame lines in black ink. A blank space is left in the center of the folio. Red pigment is used for titles and sub-titles

history.provenance: Donated by Prof E.H. Johnston in February 1940; previously belonged to Evans-Wentz, W.Y. Dr. W.Y. Evans-Wentz.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card, for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Libraries' Admissions Office.

change.persName: Camillo Formigatti modified this entry according to the https://raw.githubusercontent.com/bodleian/consolidated-tei-schema/master/msdesc.rng
